page.title: 07Employment/Trade & Education
page.content: Although the area is rural, it is not without some form of employment and trade. The stud farm, farms and riding stables do provide work, be it self employment, part time and or seasonal. The four public houses engage extra help as and when the need arises. Faygate has the most industry. The Holmbush public house, a garage, a scrapyard and timber yard, the station a forge and a transport cafe all offer work. The people of Faygate, like those of Colgate now travel to Horsham or Crawley to shop. Further along the road to Crawley there is a farm shop sellling both fresh and frozen meat.Close by is large timber and builders supply merchants serving both trade and retail. Behind this are ten large warehouse units, some of which are occupied by variety of trades.
